channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kamala Harris’s endorsements show Republicans may be paying the price for their newfound anti-business rhetoric
item.description: Anti-business rhetoric erodes a traditional area of Republican advantage.

item.title: Goldman recommends these energy stocks to play the slump in crude oil
item.description: The selloff represents an opportunity for investors to gain exposure to some high-quality stocks, according to the investment bank.

item.title: 15 companies that have rewarded long-term shareholders with high dividend income
Brian Moynihan isn’t pressing Warren Buffett on why he’s selling Bank of America shares
item.description: "I don't know what exactly he's doing because, frankly, we can't ask and we wouldn't ask."

item.title: Former FTX exec Ryan Salame returns to court after waffling on guilty plea
item.description: Former FTX exec Ryan Salame back in court over attempt to withdraw his guilty plea

item.title: Opinion: AI-powered stock ETFs were hyped as superior bets. Then reality hit.
China tells EV makers to keep tech at home by producing key parts domestically before exporting them for assembly
item.description: The instructions come as companies from BYD to Chery Automobile firm up plans to build factories in Spain to Thailand and Hungary.

item.title: McDonald's to extend $5 value meal offer into December in most U.S. markets
item.description: McDonald's and its competitors are offering meal deals as diners cut back on their restaurant spending.

item.title: Norfolk Southern fires its CEO over relationship with another executive
Why a Roth IRA is the ‘holy grail’ retirement account—no matter your income
item.description: "It’s the best possible retirement account anyone could own."

item.title: Moderna to cut $1.1 billion in costs and launch 10 new products by 2027 as it charts post-Covid path
item.description: Moderna is deprioritizing certain parts of its pipeline, which involves pausing work on some products and scrapping others.

item.title: Job market is getting tougher, but workers may be gaining in remote-work battle
Ireland launches privacy inquiry into Google AI data use in EU after halting Meta and X
item.description: Ireland's Data Protection Commission is launching an inquiry into Google's Pathways Language Model 2, after the regulator took wins against Meta and X...

item.title: GM, Hyundai agree to explore collaboration on vehicles and manufacturing to reduce capital spending
item.description: Potential areas of interest include production of passenger and commercial vehicles, internal combustion engines and electric and hydrogen technologie...

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addresses the big question on investors’ minds
